com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.crypt

Class Crypter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.crypt.Crypter

  • public class Crypter
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods to encrypt and decrypt Objects
    Author:
    Leonard Bienbeck

      The exception thrown when a decryption fails.

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public static CryptedObject encrypt(java.lang.Object o,
                                    java.lang.String password)
        Encrypts an Object and returns its encrypted equivalent CryptedObject
        Parameters:
        o - The object to encrypt
        password - The password to use for encryption
        Returns:
        The CryptedObject equivalent of the given object

      • decrypt

        public static java.lang.Object decrypt(CryptedObject co,
                                       java.lang.String password)
                                throws Crypter.DecryptionFailedException
        Decrypts a CryptedObject using a password and returns its decrypted equivalent Object
        Parameters:
        co - The CryptedObject to decrypt
        password - The password to use for decryption
        Returns:
        The decrypted object
        Throws:
        Crypter.DecryptionFailedException - If decryption fails. A wrong password will cause this.

      • encrypt

        public static byte[] encrypt(byte[] data,
                             java.lang.String rawKey)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Encrypts an array of bytes using the AES algorithm
        Parameters:
        data - The array of bytes to encrypt
        rawKey - The password to use for encryption. Warning: This password will be extended or shortened to match a length of 16 bytes (128 bit). Therefore be careful! Different passwords, starting with the same sixteen characters, result in the same AES key.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes containing the encrypted data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • decrypt

        public static byte[] decrypt(byte[] encryptedData,
                             java.lang.String rawKey)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Decrypts an array of bytes using the AES algorithm
        Parameters:
        encryptedData - The array of bytes to decrtypt
        rawKey - The password to use for decryption. Warning: This password will be extended or shortened to match a length of 16 bytes (128 bit). Therefore be careful! Different passwords, starting with the same sixteen characters, result in the same AES key.
        Returns:
        An array of bytes containing the decrypted data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
